content:
Every year, a meteorologist studying tropical storms predicts how many hurricanes will occur. The table below shows how many hurricanes were predicted and how many hurricanes actually occurred  for the years $2000$ to $2005$.
  
**Plot the data in a scatter plot to see the relationship between the predicted and actual hurricane counts.**  
  
|||||||
:-- | --: | --: | --: | --: | --: | --: | --: | --: | --: | --: | --:
**Year**|$2000$|$2001$|$2002$|$2003$|$2004$|$2005$
**Predicted** | $11$ | $13$ | $12$ | $17$ | $15$ | $17$
**Actual** | $14$ | $15$ | $12$ | $16$ | $14$ |$27$

[[â˜ƒ interactive-graph 1]]
